body.p:
Executive Department
Frankfort Ky
Aug 20th 1861
Hon Jas Guthrie
Dear Sir

In consequence of my absence from home your communication in regard to the arms at "Camp Boone" was not attended to until this moment after consultation with Genl Dudley we of the Military Board, we think Mr J. D. White the Armorer at the Arsenal here would be a suitable person to identify, demand & receive the arms from Genl. W. T. Withers & I offer his services to you. He is now at Louisville, probably stopping at the U. S. Hotel we are informed and I enclose you the authority under which he will act, if you think proper after conference with him to send him in to the camp. Genl Dudley & myself agree that unless the arms are recovered & returned to the Rail Road Company ought to be held responsible for their value. I will most cheerfully act with you in any proper effort to recover them

Most Resptly Your friend & Servt
B. Magoffin
(over)

P. S. Mr White's son has just informed me Mr White would probably not be in Louisville before tomorrow. Mr Samuel Gill knows him & doubtless take pleasure in ascertaining where he is stopping in the City

Jas Guthrie
